result.execSummary:
The defendant Major Lowell Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Major Lowell Smith in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  While going through the rights/elements, defendant stated/argued conflict of interest in moving forward with sentencing.  Court advised defendant of his options.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Argued sentencing recommendations given by State and Defense.  Defendant gave statement.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 month jail, with Huber for work release, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving.  20 days credit.  Defendant may serve sentence in Dane County, with electronic monitoring.  $518.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Must sumbit DNA sample if not previously given.  Jail start on 03-02-16 7:00 pm.  4:03/5:12
filed by Atty Long

Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant missed court on Tuesday because he had no ride available to him.  He was not released due to the transportation issue.  State requested a warrant.  Warrant authorized, will stay until close of 8/14/14.

ADA Long present in court for the State, Defendant and Atty. Riek not present. Hearing was set for 10:30 today. Court noted defendant was at Ferris Center and not released, but should have been.  Atty. Riek was at the jail this morning during this hearing's scheduled time. Hearing to be reset. Case called 11:25 adjourned 11:32
Plea hearing on August 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
